text: John Thomas Groth (July 23, 1926August 7, 2021) was an American professional baseball outfielder and scout. He played for the Detroit Tigers, St. Louis Browns, Chicago White Sox, Washington Senators, and Kansas City Athletics. His career lasted from 1946 to 1960. Groth was born in Chicago, Illinois. Groth died on August 7, 2021 at his home in Palm Beach, Florida at the age of 95. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Detroit Tigers players Category:St. Louis Browns Category:Baltimore Orioles players Category:Chicago White Sox players Category:Texas Rangers players Category:Kansas City Athletics players Category:Sportspeople from Chicago
title: Johnny Groth
